meanings.definition: One millionth of a mole per liter, used in expressing concentrations of substances in solution.
meanings.sent1: The scientist measured the concentration of the solution in micromolar units.
meanings.sent2: The lab report stated that the sample had a concentration of 10 micromolar.
meanings.sent3: It was so tiny that even a micromolar amount of salt made the soup too salty.
meanings.sent4: Her attention to detail was so precise, it was like she could measure emotions in micromolar doses.
meanings.sent5: The importance of safety precautions in the lab was emphasized by the need to handle even micromolar quantities of certain chemicals with care.
